column5: Now thats just fowl Roy and besides the world doesn't need anymore " kids".    Art
So how you making out Art... that tractor had time to cool off at all???
Got back into town last night.There is a ton of snow here.Guess I'll be shovelling the roof off,we dont build houses for this much snow. Joe
I'm glad to see you're finally home Joe. Too bad 'bout the roof, I'd I've thought Art would have taken care of that for you.  At any rate you be careful up there!

I'm trying to feel sorry for you "southerners" ...ohh wait there it is ..   no just gas.  Friends in N.C and V.A get 2" and it paralizes the area .   . They call snow days from school with even an inkling of snow on the ground......I thought rednecks were a tough bunch . The blizzard of 77 would have shut them down for about a year.
You do that and we'll send you a few of our skeeters. Not the normal 3 ounce variety either. These dudes can stand flat footed and rape a turkey.  Stay safe in the storm, Bud.

I think I may have got a bit of a sunburn today.Had a great tussle with a stingray and cuacht a grouper.Went ziplining thru the jungle canapy and took a snooze by the pool before walking to the beach to do some snorkling.I thought I saw a cloud earlier but was mistaken.Its a little too hot when the breeze dies down here. Art,there is a can of diesal in my garage for the tractor.Please check my phone messages to see if Les wants to borrow the tractor.The internet can be spotty here but you can email me if there are any problem. How are my dogs? Hosers,I think that if the US wants to retaliate for your dumping this snow on us it should be over quick.I have never seen so many Canadians as I have here in Costa Rica.Your country must be empty. Joe

Chains??? Vinnimon  we don't get this white stuff often in this amount.I bet you couldn't buy a set of chains within a 100 miles or a snowblower in 200.  But I will keep workin at it even with your distractions V   Art
Art, please take some pictures.  And your brother is saying egzactly what I would say in the same situation.  It's still not a very nice thing to do tho.  Heh heh heh.
Art has a Huge blower!!!    I'm sure of that too!!!    Where have I heard that before?
Right before you heard the ZZZZZZipper.
:lol:  :lol:
yeah...my sister is living in Baltimore... they got 30 inches...too..  sure glad I live up north...!

The official count is 35" here in Leesburg. 16 hours of tractorin to reach the main road and 2 furnaces went out due to snow blockage. Both fixed the 3rd one needs a new blower motor but Joe has 2 furnaces so it will survive. I can say that this really messed up the area pretty badly with the main roads still snow packed with less than 60 cars an hours or about 5% of the normal traffic. Next year I think I will winter inn Canada so I don't has so much snow to deal with....   Art
And here I'm praying for snow........you lucky buggers!!!  S.

Art, a storm like that would shut down any city in Canada, at least for a while.  A yard of snow in a day is nuts.  We'd dig it out and make do, friends and neighbours, much like yerselfs.  Any pictures?

And they need it! Geography wise. I was in Florida yesterday morning and the snow thing came up . . . and a gentleman asked me where we were from and told him ONTARIO CANADA . . . his answers "I guess you'll be home before us" (flight leaving at the same time) and then I asked him where he was from and he told me Arkansas . . . ? I almost broke up!  No snow in my drive way!

Yeah - we need it alright.   Another one is coming our way tomorrow and into Wednesday from what I hear.        We're running out of places to put it.   And, hats off to our borough employees and their plowing abilitities.  The street in front of my house is now only one lane and there is a good 8+ feet of snow from the curb out to where they actually plowed.   Couple that with several feet unplowed on the other side.  Sue glad we have a helpful neighbor with the equipment to finish up the boro's job in front of my house.
We ended up with 30 inches of snow on Saturday in Chester County, near Philly. Now we are expected to get upto another 2 feet tomorrow night. Crazy.
You'all wanna borrow our sled dogs yet???
Here's a glimpse of the 21 inches we got here in Pittsburgh.   Six to twelve more coming.  The backyard:    A view from the front yard:    Ally and Sarah having some fun:
Thanks Marty.. them kids is growing like weeeeds !!
ahhh thats the good stuff! we need some of that up here!!! haha.
Wow...you guys should be grooming that, not plowing it

Stick around - we have another one coming in latert today and into tomorrow.  Winter Storm Warnings are already posted for my area.  Forecast we heard this morning was for up to another foot of snow.  Of course, that's what they were predicting for the week-end storm, and we doubled that one.  Fire up the tractor again Art.

Word of caution from some one who went through the Blizzard of 77 in southern Niagara where everyone was socked in for days with over 3 feet of snow in 24 hours. The birth rate spiked 18% over normal later that year, be careful.
Dave, Art is living with goats and chickens.....I certainly hope there's no population spike.

Don't feel bad Uncle Arttie, we're s'posed to snow all day here in 'Bama tomorrow. Earlier in the week they were calling for 1-3 inches.... but they haven't said anything lately. The ground is going to be good and frozen with an over night low of 27*F, so what ever falls is going to stick.  I blame Canada for this!  ... y'all keep that dad-burned cold air to yourselves now, ya heah?  Y'all is messing up my spring Speckled Perch fishin'!!!

Well the storm is almost  here and the forcast is set for 18" to 24" before it is all over with. It seems it would be rain except for Canadas generous donation of the cold air.... So in the same spirit that you gave the cold air to us. We ( The Southern Contingency) Have officially decided to not send any Warm air up North till you stop your unwanted cold air attack...  Feel free to Email this note to all of your friends since we are working on a limited budget here at the Contingency  Thank you for your attention to this note.  Leader of the Southern Contingency   Art

Thats incredible.. its funny...  I have maybe 6" of snow on the ground here....  I dont think its climate warming, i think its climate shifting... wanna borrow my snowblower?? (oh ya... and your welcome!!)

Well the good news is we have a decent sized tractor with a bucket and blade so I will survive fine. The bad news is Daplumma and Bec's with Mom and Pops are all sitting on the beach in Costa Rica laughing at me I am sure. I'm off to get some extra fuel for the tractor before it starts that nasty white stuff falling from the sky.   Art
No snow here in Hamilton, Hamilton Ontario that is.  18 to 24"s would be more than we've had all winter. Truth is I haven't had to get the shovel out yet this winter.
Ontario is the new Viginia. Except with less possums. No snow here to speak of and none in the forecast. Make sure to build a southern snowman for us to see. (The bigger ball goes on the bottom)
Hey Art, maybe you could sell it to BC in time for the Olympics. You would just need a bigger blower...
Seeing as we didn't have any kind of summer in Ontario, this year, we decided to export some of our winter "surplus"
Dont forget to change your moccasins[?] for snow boots. If ya need any more, just let us know !!
I don't care who ya are, that's funny right there!
So I guess by next week you guys will be selling Popsicles  when it thaws we can sell you lawn fertilizer
They're calling for about a foot where I live.   The farther south, the more of a dumping. That's awfully nice of you Art to do all the plowing while Joe and the family are gone.
Im sure they laugh at ya when they are at home too...  don't feel bad.

So Art, your own parents and brother didn't invite you to go on holidays with them eh? Go easy on the goats, Joe'll be steamed if he returns to broken goats and chickens. Are you sure he's bringing you to Lakair this year?
I am sure it was Bing Crosby who sang  LET IT SNOW LET IT SNOW-better on you than on me  :thumbsup_anim:  :D  vance
Broken goats. Leave Rocket alone bud !! lol

Yea poor old left out me... Actually this is how we vacation every year. 2/3 of the farm go on vacation and then next month Mom and Pops and my wife and I go next month it makes it easier to take care of the animals. Since it is my truck and my boat that is going it is more like I am  taking JOE to Lak Air but since yall are lookin forward to us visitin I guess he gets to come along.  Art  Don't worry Wayne "Rocket" and all of the other goats are warm,dry and well fed....
Well you can borrow my snowthrower Art, I certainly don't need it
Why are all of the nice people offering me the machine without the operator??? I rechecked the forcast and it has gone up to 30Inches for now.....   Art
30 inches... lol.. thats just a dusting, no equipment needed...
Sorry Art, I gotta work the weekend (along with the other days).  Starting to fall there yet? Michael
You pay my flight down, I'll operate it for ya no prob
I think aplumma needs ashovel.   http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2010/02/06/u...washington.html

We ended up with about 2 feet of that white stuff.  Thank goodness for kind neighbors with snow blowers or I'd still be out there.   Went ahead and removed the snow from our 2-car garage, as I'm assuming there was a tremendous amount of weight up there.  Now - If I can even move tomorrow, it will be a wonder.   My mother also has very accommodating neighbors, or I'd be up there trying to get her dug out.    OK - Enough of winter already.  South of us, had even more.  Maybe Art will pop in and tell us how much he got down there.
Good luck to our southern contingent!!

Well I have been tractoring  for 9 hours today and still havent reached the road. The blade does nothing so it is scoop a bucket and then turn to the side and dump....repeat a gazillion times. The monotony breaker is get the tractor unstuck. This is a big tractor too.  If I find out Canada "attacked" us on purpose I'm comin up there in June and drowned all of your muskies at Lak Air   Art
